reviews.review: good game but, MY POTATOE PC CANT HANDLE IT

At the time of this writing, this review is based only on solo play and it is primarily based on the first two sections of the primary level (Level 0).

At around three hours in, I'm going to give this a hesitant 'Yes' vote. If it were not in Early Access, I'd say No, but as it is new, in Early/Alpha Access, a small team, and is being regularly worked on; I'll give it the benefit of the doubt. I will, however, play it much more to establish that my initial opinion holds.

For the positives: I truly appreciate the lack of a motion-blur! The controls are fluid and mostly intuitive. So far there has been no voice acting, but the sound effects are solid. The graphics are quite nice, and this game has one of the best presentations and uses of the smiling entity in any of the Backrooms games that I've played (and I own around 15 or so at this point). The death animations are the best out there, and the remaining bloodstains are a good addition. The found-footage/VHS effect is well done and unintrusive, which is a nice change for many of these games. The black puddle triggers were a pleasant surprise as is the suit-color choice; you don't see much customization in Backrooms games. The Dev is responsive to the community and is very hands on.

A neutral point: so far, there have been no puzzles.

The negatives: if you're going to have solo-play, get a decent fu*cking save system implemented for gamer's with lives outside of gaming. That's my usual rant :)

The map isn't very randomized, nor does it seem, are the resource locations. This allows for map-memorization, which lessens replay value and takes away from some of the immersion and sense of dread. Backrooms games are, per cannon, about confused wandering and lonely isolation with looming and ever-present dread. I can see where this lack of randomization is a positive to some, but it is a negative for me (at least a randomization of resources and exit-doors would change the 'feel' for me). This is, however, addressed in the Dungeon Crawler mode. It has a different mode of game-play, but it has procedure-generated levels.

You can run endlessly, but if you pause while being chased, you cannot pick up speed once more. You also drop to a crawl at first injury. Once spotted, you cannot escape the entity and they're so difficult to get around in the second phase of Level 0, that I'll go so far as to call it unbalanced (and this is being worked on, so I doubt that it will remain an issue).

Lastly, and this is a minor technical glitch that will likely be adjusted in future fixes, but on many walls and the Level 0 first door, if you stand up against it, you can see through it, and once I got stuck in a wall and could not get out. Sudden head-turns in level 1-2 break up the animation a bit. Those are, however, the only glitches that I have encountered so far, and for Early Access, that is pretty good.

So, the TL/DR version: it's on the right track but needs some entity-avoidance balance and a decent 'save' function. As an Early Access game, there are a few graphics and small glitches that need to be addressed, but nothing major. Otherwise, it's heading towards being a solid entry into the Backrooms genre!
reviews.developer_response:
Thank you for your review!

Quite a few of your points you brought up I am working on as I type this to you. Randomization is in place in levels, however I have kept it to a minimum for now to work bugs out before ramping it up. 

I agree with you on many of the points you bring up and plan to be fixing these in future updates. Thank you and enjoy!

reviews.review:
So the game seems like the developer would actually have a vision what he wants to do but the execution... oh man.
in a lot of areas the game runs at 15 FPS which is unacceptable, you really don't know where, when or why you are going to be teleported to the next area. There are different locations to explore and one gameplay element I could find was collecting some pink shining stuff before the monster kills you. But even if you get killed, you are just spawning new with no effects. But the spawning is bugged, so often it won't load or the player is stuck and can't continue.
I played with a friend 2 runs and both times we got stuck / bugged in the "birthday" level with the red carpet and balloons.
Would not recommend in this state and after 6 months the possibility of improving the game is quite low so...

The level 0 graphics aren't that great, the bacteria isn't scary whatsoever (not to say that short people can't be scary,) the key in level 0 doesn't work on the only locked wooden door, you end up with dozens of vases, only a few of which you need, the list goes on. I am so far not impressed but will update after playing some more - if I do.
reaaaaaaaaaly buggy and the menu is messed up when in game! I couldnt play.

So there's a great deal wrong here. I encountered multiple bugs out of the gate, first of which was defining controls. The control visuals on the screen changed when I set the buttons, but when I went back into the interface to swap a button the visuals didn't reflect those changes. I ended up setting them 3 times thinking it wasn't doing anything. Flashlight, interact, and crouch don't have default buttons.

Second bug was the player names not displaying in the lobby. Mouse sensitivity isn't low enough, even for 800 dpi. I have my Nvidia "Low Latency Mode" set to ultra, which can often impact cameras, and in this case it made the game nearly unplayable on "50". Lower required.

AI tracking is either find you anywhere, despawn after giving up, or simply lose track of you for almost no reason and wander away. They often spawn behind you and trap you places for almost no reason.

Climbing into a locker broke my run. It also seems to happen randomly when crouching, but it can also repair run, so I don't really know what is happening there.

This needs a lot of work and some literal days devoted to QA with multiple people before I'll consider devoting time to it.
garbage. enemies are randomly spawned in, frame rate is abysmal, terrible gameplay. not good at all.
This game is so bad do not buy its not worth it
Runs terribly and is so horribly optimized that it runs at 40 fps on my gaming pc. Do not buy this game, buy any other backrooms game

probably the worst game ive played in years. you get keys that dont even work at the hub and and if you think you have the right key nope you havent. not scary, fun or even playable. DONY BUY THIS FUCKING GAME
Im running on 10 fps and trying to get anything to work was a challenge but i feel like this game has potential. Probably don't release it when its this undeveloped even if its early access.
reviews.developer_response: If you could join the discord to discuss further and  I will work to solve frame rate issues as no issues like that had been reported yet.
